H0.text: Carry oxygen is the primary function of white blood cells in humans.

H1.text: Fight disease is the primary function of white blood cells in humans.

H2.text: Grow tissues is the primary function of white blood cells in humans.

H3.text: Remove waste is the primary function of white blood cells in humans.

A4.text: White blood cells are part of the body's immune system. They help the body fight infection and other diseases.

A5.text: Monocytes eventually leave the bloodstream and become tissue macrophages, which remove dead cell debris as well as attack microorganisms.
